captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Jayce, the Defender of Tomorrow.
Jayce changes between melee and ranged, either initiating fights and soaking up damage or taking out enemies from afar.
Clever manipulation of these two stances is the key to victory.
Jayce’s ultimate is Transform and is automatically learned at level 1.
When activated, Jayce transforms his weapon between the Mercury Hammer and the Mercury Cannon, each with their own unique abilities.
After transforming to the Cannon, Jayce’s next basic attack will reduce his target’s armor and magic resist.
When transforming to the Hammer, his first basic attack will deal bonus damage.
Additionally, Jayce gains bonus armor and magic resistance while wielding the Mercury Hammer.
Jayce’s passive is Hextech Capacitor. Every time Jayce Transforms his weapon, he gains bonus movement speed for a short time.
With the Mercury Hammer equipped, To the Skies causes Jayce to leap to target enemy, damaging and slowing surrounding foes.
Lightning Field passively causes Jayce’s basic attacks to restore his mana.
When activated, it damages nearby enemies every second for a few seconds.
Thundering Blow damages, knocks back, and briefly stuns target enemy.
Thundering Blow deals bonus damage based on the target’s maximum health.
While wielding the Mercury Cannon, Shock Blast fires out a skill shot nuke that detonates at the end of its range or when striking an enemy, damaging all enemies caught in the explosion.
Hyper Charge greatly increases Jayce’s attack speed for his next few basic attacks.
Acceleration Gate places a wall that increases the movement speed of all allies who pass through it.
Additionally, firing Shock Blast through Acceleration Gate will increase its speed, range, and damage.
When jungling as Jayce, remember to constantly Transform weapons to increase your damage.
For example, starting in Mercury Cannon, hitting Hyper Charge, and then Transforming for the bonus damage and Lightning Field is one of the fastest ways to clear through the jungle.
Opening as a ranged physical carry, Jayce performs best when helping ganks.
As Nunu comes in from behind, Jayce opens with Acceleration Gate and Shock Blast into Transform.
To the Skies, Lightning Storm, and Ignite deal incredible damage against Janna and Miss Fortune, picking up First Blood and assisting in the second kill.
Jayce’s early game is extremely potent in a solo lane, as you can deal plenty of damage in a short time.
Land a basic attack from Mercury Cannon, Transform, hit To the Skies and land another basic attack all while Lightning Field is activated.
The best time to dive a turret is when you have a minion wave to distract it.
Acceleration Gate plus Shock Blast takes a chunk out of Gangplank’s health and then lets Jayce kite with the movement speed.
Jayce then lands To the Skies and a basic attack, picking up First Blood underneath the turret.
Jayce has a lot of interesting ability combinations. With the Mercury Hammer, the slow from To the Skies makes it extremely easy to hit Shock Blast.
Then as Gangplank is low, Acceleration Gate makes a second Shock Blast deal incredible amounts of damage, picking up a second kill.
Jayce’s skillset also allows him to make the best of some sticky situations.
Opening with the Mercury Cannon, Acceleration Gate on top of Transform lets Jayce create a lot of distance from Gangplank.
Once Rammus’s taunt wears off, Thundering Blow from the Mercury Hammer shoves Gangplank back, allowing Jayce to Flash safely underneath his turret.
Soon after, Gragas comes in to gank. Choosing to fight with the Mercury Cannon, Shock Blast through Acceleration Gate softens up Gangplank, allowing Jayce to close in for the kill.
Transforming to the Mercury Hammer, landing To the Skies, Lightning Field, and Thundering Blow takes down Gangplank.
Shock Blast briefly reveals the fog of war when it explodes, meaning you can use it to find a target for To the Skies, either to initiate a jungle camp or to escape from your enemies.
Be careful about engaging in melee range if you aren’t built for durability.
Jayce jumps in on Graves with To the Skies, Thundering Blow, and Lightning Field, picking up the kill.
However, he’s also quickly focused down by Rumble and dies.
Another way to handle fights with a squishier build is to fight with the Mercury Cannon and team up on secluded enemies.
Shock Blast and Acceleration Gate make the beginning of the fight easy as Alistar takes plenty of damage, and Jayce keeps his distance from Rumble.
Upon finding Shyvana diving Graves below him, he Transforms, lands To the Skies, and quickly drops her.
Now with a numbers advantage it’s easy for the blue team to group up and continue the fight.

I recommend focusing on one primary form in each game you play, building more durability to rely on the Mercury Hammer or maxing out your damage while ignoring survival when relying on the Mercury Cannon.
Let’s look at an example Mercury Cannon build.
For Runes, try Flat Attack Damage Marks, Flat Armor Seals, Magic Resist per Level Glyphs, and Flat Attack Damage Quintessences.
For Masteries, I recommend 21/9/0, taking all the physical damage increasing masteries in Offense plus Armor and Health in Defense.
For Summoner Spells, Ignite and Flash will let you play aggressively to kill opponents while also allowing you to escape from bad fights.
For items, open with Boots of Speed, Health Potions, and Doran’s Blades or a Prospector’s Blade.
Upgrade to Berserker’s Greaves, buy Vampiric Scepter, and build toward Infinity Edge.
Add a Phantom Dancer, Last Whisper, Bloodthirster or Sanguine Blade, and finish with Banshee’s Veil or Odyn’s Veil.
Thanks for tuning into the Jayce Champion Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel above and leave us your comments just below the video!

recommend Guardian Angel but I've never liked that item, so I usually get 
something like Randuins, Banshees or Maw.

comments.text:
Jayce, hands down. Jayce has basics you can catch after some games. 
However, reaching his max potential takes some serious skill. He is a jack 
of all trades, can go virtually any lane, yeah I said it. And has a kit 
with literally almost everything you can ask for. However, there are a huge 
number of possible combos, play styles, and roles Jayce can fill.

comments.text:
Can people PLEASE stop saying to Q E? It is NOT the best way to do it. E on 
yourself, Q immediatly after. Gate on yourself means easy engage/escape 
after plus instant sped up Q, which isn't just hard to dodge, it's 
impossible to dodge. EQ people, EQ.﻿

comments.author: Jeremy Waites

comments.text:
Lol idk what elo you're in but you sound dumb. QE Cannon form is the best 
way. Why? 1. Less reaction time, if your opponents saw you place E down, 
they get that split sec of dodging it which will affect you. Also you claim 
it's a good disengage. However QE Can is a poke move, if you're going for 
thr kill, just run through the gate after you've landed your Q.QE is a 
higher elo Jayce move that every good player should do. Check out Narakyle, 
Pawn, etc.

comments.text:
+MadA I am talking about the way I specifically play because I can then 
actually tell you why I do things that way. I was indeed talking about 
ranged form explicitly and I never denied that, I said that at the time it 
fit perfectly with the other comments. I also went a bit more in-depht to 
explain my reasoning on  my playstyle. Every champ can of course be played 
different ways, so I tried to explain my way. The gate part is what I ment 
specifically annoys me as the gate placed on yourself versus away from you 
after you Q is just objectively better. I explained why, even if everyone 
else was talking about melee it is still a relevant and good point. And 
your point is what exactly? I'm discussing good ways to play a champion and 
that's rediculous? Is every player a unique, perfect little snowflake? 
Please, show the world you have some substance and aren't just trying to 
provoke dumb arguments.
comments.author: Smonsequenses

comments.text:
+Smonsequenses Actually dude, his comment has perfect placement. You 
specifically said "gate on yourself means easy engage/escape" which implies 
you WERE talking about explicitly cannon stance, not hammer stance. You're 
also speaking as if everyone plays the champ the same way as you which 
makes you sound ridiculous, on top of the fact that you're basically 
denying writing something that we can all see. What a clown.
comments.author: MadA

comments.text:
+Jeremy Waites
During laning fase you are walking around in cannon form most of the time 
anyway. You always want to end your trades in hammerstance because it give 
defensive stats, making sure you win the trade. The ranged E-Q combo is 
what you want to be using most, if you engage with hammer in lane you are 
even more easy to gank and waste a lot more mana. I only switch to hammer 
in lane for mana regen, defensive stats/knockback or if I know I can finish 
someone off. There are a lot of combo's you can pull off with Jayce, but 
the E-Q ranged combo is the only one that's done consistently wrong without 
people knowing the reasoning behind it. Nobody uses E-Q in hammerstance 
anyway and I'm pretty sure I wasn't making assumptions at the time, but 
since this comment is over a month old the discussion has long died out and 
your smartass comment seems kinda out of place.
comments.author: Smonsequenses

comments.text:
Q E is hammer form Dingus... Q e hammer form, it knocks them back and they 
are slowed, so you can use that time to THEN switch to ranged and as you 
said E Q. Since he has two forms perhaps you should take into consideration 
the combos on the separate forms, not just assume they are talking about 
the ranged form

comments.text:
One more thing, Jayce can go anywhere, he is a jack of all trades, one 
again, you will need to completely change your playing style to adjust. 
I've taken him everywhere and have had excellent success. He is however, 
only a modest support. However he still has 2 CC abilities and a speed 
buff, so adjust for the best of your ADC. I like to flash, or to the skies 
behind an enemy and knock them into our tower/ towards my adc. Who then can 
proceed to murder. Of course, Jayce ADC is even better than support. =3
comments.author: ClTRlS

comments.text:
Jayce has easy basics, but has an extremely high ceiling cap. If you're 
building damage Jayce, which is what I usually build him, you want to make 
sure to switch stances at the right time. A bad switch can mean the end. 
Remember, melee offers resistance. So switch to melee when you see incoming 
attacks, this can be an insane lifesaver.
comments.author: ClTRlS

comments.text:
Jayce is powerful early game, Very powerful mid, and powerful late. 
However, you have to change your style over time. Early game, use Jayce's 
high damage and longer range to harass and deny other champions of CS. In 
mid game, your poke nearly 1 shots squishy targets, so use that to engage. 
Once you've reached late game, make sure to have your w at max rang and 
have some crit chance with you too. The 2.5 per sec attack speed and highly 
increased damage plus crits will literally 2-3 shot their adc, mage or any 
squishy target. Jayce can destroy tanks in Melee stance, so engage in 
ranged and go in melee using to the skies and lightning field, then 
afterwards, shred them with your thundering blow, which deals percent 
damage.
comments.author: ClTRlS

comments.text:
+GoldPaladinHD Gaming
Jayce is still a good champion when played right, you really need to take 
the time to learn him tho. His manamanagement is pretty hard and a lot of 
people don't know the optimal ways to pull of his combo's. Having 6 skills 
and no ult makes him pretty complex, but on the other hand being a ranged 
champ makes lasthitting pretty easy. Like I said if you take the time it's 
worth it, as with so many other champions that may not be considered 
heavily ''OP'' or whatever atm.

comments.text:
+Mr Akshay I played him Jungle and found him amazing at it. You just have 
to really change your play style with Jayce. Just remember hammer stance 
offers protection, you need to know that to combat his issues. However, 
ganking is great. Ideally, you want to poke, grab the speed up, then 
proceed to "To the Skies" the enemy and knock them towards whoever you're 
ganking. His chasing is great, and his versatile kit, 2 CC abilities, and a 
speed up to get your and your gankee out of the action make him an 
excellent jungler if played correctly.
comments.author: ClTRlS

comments.author: carlosdiaz66

comments.text:
why play jayce? well his skill cap is incredibly high but his kit works in 
such a way that you can carry a teamfight all by yourself...since you don't 
rely on any sort of "ultimate" damage it's incredibly easy to clean up 
fights especially with someone who can switch between range and mele simply 
because you have reliable damage abilities with very low cooldowns...plus 
manamune once finished and activated will be destruction for the enemy team 
(think of it as a physical damage ryze)...so overall jayce is very hard to 
play but if mastered he's rewarding as hell and with the recent tear buff 
he's back and ready to stomp solo que﻿

comments.author: C r y p t i k

comments.text:
lol at everyone commenting "I build Jayce IE, BotRK, LW", I don't get it, 
why build  IE and BotRK on a champion who is not even AA dependant and that 
already has a max speed boost? Seriously...he's not an adc...btw, LW is 
good on him, but I feel like it's really situational (I usually build it 
when there are more than 2 tanks, if that's not the case, I leave it out), 
BC works way better as a core item, because of how fast he stacks it and 
the good amount of health it gives.

I main him, and I prefer to build him as an offtank ad caster with 25% (or 
35%) cdr, nice armor pen, lots of health, defenses, sustain, and some 
godlike ad and AoE damage, I go:
Manamune, IBG (it gives him very good armor, burst, AoE, additional Slow, 
and some good mana to increase the Muramana passive, it's great on him, 
probably better than TF), Ravenous Hydra (yep, believe me, it works really 
damn well, even better than BT, it gives him very good damage, even more 
AoE, and the sustain he needs), BC, situational boots, and, situational ad 
or defense item, usually SV, GA, Warmog's or LW.
Trust me, this build is beautiful, late and mid game you rape the whole 
enemy team SO hard, that they start focusing you instead of your adc lulz.﻿

comments.text:
As a jayce main, I'll will show you my build for him. Go ad reds and 
lifesteal quints for early sustain with a Dorans blade. Standard ad 
masteries. rush manamune with boots, then brutalizer. This is where his mid 
game shines. If we're loosing, i go for warmogs for tankyness. My dmg is 
still viable while being able to sustain in teamfights. Then go for LW. All 
items after are usually situational.﻿

almost any ad item would, but its kinda useless if he doesn't get too many 
kills.
